content: this super-simple hat was designed to show off the yarn and create a lightweight yet warm and cosy hat that you can barely feel when you re wearing it and will stuff in a pocket when you need to take it off actually i just wanted it for hiking with really and i know 1x1 ribbing is a pain to do but i really wanted a brim of clingy fabric so that it s less likely to blow off in the wind coniston fingering is a singles yarn with mohair in which is designed to emulate the fabric you get when you hold 2ply or 4ply double with a fluffy laceweight mohair use a smooth 4ply if you prefer **yarn** eden cottage yarns coniston fingering 360m/ yds per 100g skein quantity 1 x 100g skein **needles and accessories** 2 75mm needles suitable for working at a fairly small circumference suggestions dpns addi crasytrio or similar a long circular for magic loop or a 30-40cm circular needle the 40cm might feel slightly too small stitch marker **sizing** circumference approx 26cm after washing but unstretched will stretch to around 50cm height from cast on edge to top of crown approx 19cm after washing but unstretched **gauge** 30 sts x 38 row over 10 x 10cm square in stocking stitch on 2 75mm needles
